{"step_by_step_thinking": "Ossifying fibroma is a benign bone tumor that is often found in the jaw. It is characterized by the replacement of normal bone with fibrous tissue and calcified material, which would appear as radiopaque on an X-ray. However, it is typically unilocular, meaning it appears as a single, well-defined mass.", "answer_choice": "B. Unilocular radiopoacity."}
